name: NeuraGen AI
founding_story_summary: Founded from UCL AI research to enable real-time diagnostic analytics and predictive models in healthcare combining machine learning with clinical workflows for better patient outcomes.
mission_statement: To empower clinicians through transparent, actionable AI insights that improve patient outcomes and operational efficiencies.
primary_products: NeuraDiagnose Platform; PredictCare AI Suite; NeuroGenomics Insights
primary_services: Clinical analytics; predictive modelling; operational workflow optimization
core_ip_assets: Deep learning diagnostic pipelines; genomic data integration;AI explainability layers
banking_partners: Royal Bank of Scotland; Wells Fargo
major_customers: NHS Trusts; Mayo Clinic; Genentech; Medisafe Health
major_suppliers: NVIDIA; Intel AI Labs; Cobalt CyberGuard (C004) security
go_to_market_strategy: Direct sales to health systems; partnership with Medisafe and TechForge; academic collaborations
pricing_model: Subscription seat-based pricing + volume data fees; implementation charges
primary_cloud_provider: AWS with GCP backup for compliance and research
security_certifications: ISO 13485; ISO 27001; HIPAA; FDA AI Software Pre-cert
environmental_goals: Carbon-neutral by 2032; 80% renewable energy by 2026; zero single-use plastics
diversity_goals: 48% women/non-binary leadership by 2028; inclusive hiring policies; accessibility initiatives
esg_policy_summary: ESG program centers on patient privacy, equitable AI, sustainable operations, and transparent governance.
risk_register_top3: 1. Clinical validation risk; 2. Regulatory approval delays; 3. Data privacy compliance risk
competitors: IBM Watson Health; Google DeepMind Health; PathAI; Veracyte
regulators: MHRA UK; FDA US; EMA EU
cash_management_policy: Maintain 10 months liquidity buffer; 55% cash in UK gilts; limit vendor exposures
treasury_risk_limits: VaR $2M daily; max single asset $8M; FX hedge Â±$0.5M
board_committees: Audit; Regulatory Compliance; Compensation; ESG; Nominating
